page.title: 19Local History of Taverham
page.content: {Taverham Hall manor}was rebuilt in the 18th century. The family crest is on the pier walls on the Ringland side. Cottages opposite the gates to the hall were built side on to the St. so that the cottagers couldn't see the comings & goings from their windows. The present building was built in 1860 It had 12 gardeners and 10 domestics at 4d. per week. In 1919 the estate was sold, tenant farmers bought their land and the{prep. school}was started. By 1701 the{mill}was making paper on a site in the Hall grounds and by 1845 produced paper for the{Times and {Mirror Newspapers, the Oxford English {Dictionary and bank notes.}There were 3 water wheels, 2 with a diam. of 4 m. and 1 of 2 m. There were 2 wells of clean water for the paper and 3 sluice gates which still control the river. In{1914-18}the cavalry used the wells.
